results.title: A Portrait of Bishhop Carlos Ximenes Belo
results.creator_credit: Max Stahl, Gillan Films and Intervision
results.brief_description: This program documents the impact of the Indonesian invasion of East Timor. It particularly focuses on the role of Bishop Carlos Ximenes Belo. He believes that he should be outspoken about the atrocities suffered by the people of East Timor because of the Indonesian occupation. The format consists of film footage depicting life in East Timor: a commentary and interviews with Bishop Belo, the Indonesian General Herman Mantiri and East Timorese people.

results.title: A Scream from silence = Mourir a tue-tete
results.creator_credit: Anne-Claire Poirier, Jacques Gagne and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: This feature film documents the rape and eventual suicide of Suzanne, a nurse whose physical and emotional health deteriorates beyond repair as a result of the violence inflicted on her. Images of ritual and mass rape reinforce the horror of this act of domination. In this docudrama drawn from case histories, the filmmaker explores social attitudes that cause women to feel guilty for being raped. It touches upon the physical, emotional, spiritual and legal aspects of this crime. Cast includes Luce Guillbeault, Germaine Houde, Michele Mercure. (Awards: Chicago; Houston.)

results.title: A Pornographic affair = Une Liaison pornographique [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Frederic Fonteyne, Claude Waringo, Patrick Quinet, Rolf Schmid, ARP, Artemis Productions, Canal+, Fama Film, Le Production Lazemec, Radio Television Belge Francophone (RTBF) and Samsa Film
results.brief_description: Two strangers, played by Nathalie Baye and Sergi Lopez, meet through a personal ad in a pornographic magazine. They are both interested in exploring a sexual fantasy that for a variety of reasons they feel shy of disclosing with regular partners. Filmed in flashback, while the two characters are interviewed straight to the camera, this erotic and intelligent film explores how men and women are navigating the fraught arena of sexual desire in a post-feminist and post-macho culture. Both Baye and Lopez deliver charming and realistic performances in which they present the ambiguities and contradictions of modern urban life: on one hand proud and happy with their independence; on the other aching for the comfort and solidity of dependency. In the end, the sexual fantasy which begins this pornographic affair, does not matter: it is up to the viewer to interpret the relationship through the nature of our own desires and fantasies. Beyond sex, desire and fantasy, “A Pornographic Affair” argues that what matters is our ability to communicate and to be open to being touched by another human being. In French with English subtitles.

results.title: A Salute to Mel Blanc
results.brief_description: This is a tribute collection of classic cartoons dedicated to the remarkable voice of Mel Blanc. He was the voice of so many well known cartoon characters including Bugs Bunny, Daffy Duck, Porky Pig, Pepe Le Pew, Yosemite Sam, Tweety and Sylvester and each of these selected cartoons features at least one of Mel Blanc’s characterisations. Interestingly, the dialogue was recorded before the animators did their work meaning that Mel Blanc had to imagine and create the action from a series of sketches. This is no mean feat and requires a lot of skill and energy. Mel Blanc died in 1989 but his voice lives on in the much-loved Looney Tunes and Merrie Melodies cartoons which are still showing around the world today. Suitable viewing for all the family.

results.title: A Rose for Emily
results.creator_credit: Lyndon Chubbuck, H Kaye Dyal and Chubbuck Cinema Company
results.brief_description: When Miss Emily Grierson, the town’s aristocrat, was young, her tyrannical father drove her suitors away. After his death, Emily succumbed to the advances of a man beneath her station and this film shows the consequences of this event. This film is a twentieth century Gothic tale dealing in the mysterious and the macabre and is of interest to both film and literature classes. Stars Angelica Huston and John Carradine and adapted from the short story by William Faulkner. Narrated by John Houseman.
